title: Nathan Sanchiz-Viel
text: Welcome here !

title: Introduction to Big Data
text:
This Big Data course introduces the fundamentals of information retrieval from data. It covers key concepts such as the distinction between data, information, and knowledge, as well as the principle of abstraction in computer science. These concepts are illustrated through concrete applications and put into practice through projects inspired by real-world professional scenarios.
The course is primarily self-directed, and assessment is based exclusively on the completion of two projects.

title: Image Synthesis by Inverse Rendering (SIRI)
text:
This part of the course focuses on realistic image synthesis through inverse rendering, with an emphasis on generating new images from existing ones. It first introduces 2D image-based synthesis methods, such as interpolation and extrapolation.
The course then presents photogrammetry as a framework for producing realistic images from multi-view reconstructions. Finally, it introduces various representations for view synthesis, ranging from point clouds and splats to modern continuous representations, and analyzes their contributions and limitations for the production of realistic images.

1) Charger un premier jeu de donnÃ©es
On utilise un dataset local fourni par scikit-learn (pas besoin dâ€™Internet).

from sklearn.datasets import load_iris

iris = load_iris(as_frame=True)
df = iris.frame.copy()
df.rename(columns={"target": "species"}, inplace=True)
df["species"] = df["species"].map(dict(enumerate(iris.target_names)))

title: Mini-pipeline dâ€™analyse (intro)
text:
3) (Simuler) un problÃ¨me rÃ©aliste : valeurs manquantes
Pour illustrer le nettoyage, on introduit volontairement quelques NaN.

df_dirty = df.copy()

# Introduire ~5% de valeurs manquantes dans deux colonnes
mask1 = np.random.rand(len(df_dirty)) < 0.05
mask2 = np.random.rand(len(df_dirty)) < 0.05

df_dirty.loc[mask1, "sepal length (cm)"] = np.nan
df_dirty.loc[mask2, "petal width (cm)"] = np.nan

df_dirty.isna().mean().sort_values(ascending=False)

title: Mini-pipeline dâ€™analyse (intro)
text:
4) Nettoyage
Ici, stratÃ©gie simple : imputation par mÃ©diane (sur les colonnes numÃ©riques).

df_clean = df_dirty.copy()

num_cols = df_clean.select_dtypes(include=["number"]).columns
for c in num_cols:
    df_clean[c] = df_clean[c].fillna(df_clean[c].median())

df_clean.isna().sum()

5) Transformation (feature engineering lÃ©ger)
On crÃ©e 2 variables simples : - ratio pÃ©tale/sepale - surface approx. pÃ©tale (longueur Ã— largeur)
Lâ€™idÃ©e : transformations cohÃ©rentes au service dâ€™une question.

df_feat = df_clean.copy()

df_feat["petal_area"] = df_feat["petal length (cm)"] * df_feat["petal width (cm)"]
df_feat["petal_to_sepal_ratio"] = df_feat["petal length (cm)"] / df_feat["sepal length (cm)"]
